channel.title: BBC News - Business

item.title: Covid: Government warns Covid test firms over misleading prices
item.description: More than 80 Covid test firms are issued with warnings and could be removed from the government's website.

item.title: Wildfires: Provence wine producers assess impact of destruction
item.description: There are fears the fires that have hit rosé vineyards in Provence will push up prices.

item.title: Lorry drivers: Act now to avert crisis, government told
item.description: Retailers and lorry firms join forces in call for new work visas, training and better Covid testing.

item.title: House prices: Demand changes, not tax waiver, pushed prices up
item.description: The stamp duty holiday did not cause rising house prices, the Resolution Foundation think tank says.

item.title: Climate change: Will I still be able to fly in a net zero world?
item.description: A new study asks if lifestyle changes including an end to flying will be necessary to reach net zero?

item.title: Nvidia's takeover of Arm raises serious concerns, says watchdog
item.description: The UK competition watchdog mounts an in-depth probe into US firm Nvidia’s proposed £29bn takeover of Arm.

item.title: M&S says recovery plan boosting sales and profits
item.description: The High Street giant's shares soar on upbeat trading news, as official figures show UK retail sales sank in July.

item.title: Apple delays recalling staff to the office until 2022
item.description: The decision comes as fears grow over the impact of surging Covid cases in the US.

item.title: Morrisons backs US firm's improved £7bn takeover offer
item.description: But shares in the supermarket open higher, suggesting some investors think the £7bn-plus battle is not over.

item.title: Government borrowing shrinks in July
item.description: Despite a fall, borrowing was still the second-highest on record for July as Covid spending continues.

item.title: BHP sacked 48 over sexual harassment and assaults at Australian mines
item.description: An Australian inquiry has heard allegations of rape and sexual harassment at remote mining camps.

item.title: Sky Broadband says online access problems resolved
item.description: Sky customers complained they could not access some online services including at banks HSBC and TSB.

item.title: Brazil hopes the world will get a taste for its favourite spirit
item.description: With domestic sales of cachaça falling last year, Brazilian producers want to export more.

item.title: Love and money: Why breaking-up is so hard to do
item.description: More people are looking for help in paying for divorces after relationships ended during Covid.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Don't ask for all your funding up front
item.description: Don't ask for all your funding at once, says Zazuu CEO Kay Akinwunmi, but in smaller chunks.

item.title: Never mind going electric, where will we park?
item.description: UK roads are already jam-packed and that looks set to get worse as more people snap up EVs.

item.title: Just how hard is it to recycle a jumbo jet?
item.description: Thousands of aircraft were left on the tarmac due to Covid, and many will now be broken up for parts.

item.title: Would you let a robot lawyer defend you?
item.description: Why artificial intelligence is increasingly being used by the legal profession.
